verses.verse: Can you draw<WH4900> out leviathan<WH3882> with an hook?<WH100> or his tongue<WH3956> with a cord<WH2256> which you let<WH8257> down?<WH8257>
Can you put<WH7760> an hook<WH2443> into his nose?<WH639> or bore<WH5344> his jaw<WH3895> through with a thorn?<WH2336>
Will he make many<WH7235> supplications<WH8469> to you? will he speak<WH1696> soft<WH7390> words to you?
Will he make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with you? will you take<WH3947> him for a servant<WH5650> for ever?<WH5769>
Will you play<WH7832> with him as with a bird?<WH6833> or will you bind<WH7194> him for your maidens?<WH5291>
Shall the companions<WH2271> make a banquet<WH3738> of him? shall they part<WH2673> him among<WH996> the merchants?<WH3669>
Can you fill<WH4390> his skin<WH5785> with barbed<WH7905> irons?<WH7905> or his head<WH7218> with fish<WH1709> spears?<WH6767>
Lay<WH7760> your hand<WH3709> on him, remember<WH2142> the battle,<WH4421> do no<WH408> more.<WH3254>
Behold,<WH2005> the hope<WH8431> of him is in vain:<WH3576> shall not one be cast<WH2904> down<WH2904> even<WH1571> at the sight<WH4758> of him?
None<WH3808> is so fierce<WH393> that dare stir<WH5782> him up: who<WH4310> then is able to stand<WH3320> before<WH6440> me?
Who<WH4310> has prevented<WH6923> me, that I should repay<WH7999> him? whatever is under<WH8478> the whole<WH3605> heaven<WH8064> is mine.
I will not conceal<WH2790> his parts,<WH905> nor his power,<WH1369> nor his comely<WH2433> proportion.<WH6187>
Who<WH4310> can discover<WH1540> the face<WH6440> of his garment?<WH3830> or who<WH4310> can come<WH935> to him with his double<WH3718> bridle?<WH7448>
Who<WH4310> can open<WH6605> the doors<WH1817> of his face?<WH6440> his teeth<WH8127> are terrible<WH367> round<WH5439> about.
His scales<WH650> <WH4043> are his pride,<WH1346> shut<WH5462> up together as with a close<WH6862> seal.<WH2368>
One<WH259> is so near<WH5066> to another,<WH259> that no<WH3808> air<WH7307> can come<WH935> between<WH996> them.
They are joined<WH1692> one<WH376> to another,<WH251> they stick<WH3920> together, that they cannot<WH3808> be sundered.<WH6504>
By his neesings<WH5846> a light<WH216> does shine,<WH1984> and his eyes<WH5869> are like the eyelids<WH6079> of the morning.<WH7837>
Out of his mouth<WH6310> go<WH1980> burning<WH3940> lamps,<WH3940> and sparks<WH3590> of fire<WH784> leap<WH4422> out.
Out of his nostrils<WH5156> goes<WH3318> smoke,<WH6227> as out of a seething<WH5301> pot<WH1731> or caldron.<WH100>
His breath<WH5315> kindles<WH3857> coals,<WH1513> and a flame<WH3851> goes<WH3318> out of his mouth.<WH6310>
In his neck<WH6677> remains<WH3885> strength,<WH5797> and sorrow<WH1670> is turned<WH1750> into joy before<WH6440> him.
The flakes<WH4651> of his flesh<WH1320> are joined<WH1692> together: they are firm<WH3332> in themselves; they cannot<WH1077> be moved.<WH4131>
His heart<WH3820> is as firm<WH3332> as a stone;<WH68> yes, as hard<WH3332> as a piece<WH6400> of the nether<WH8482> millstone.
When he raises<WH7613> up himself, the mighty<WH410> are afraid:<WH1481> by reason of breakings<WH7667> they purify<WH2398> themselves.
The sword<WH2719> of him that lays<WH5381> at him cannot<WH1097> hold:<WH6965> the spear,<WH2595> the dart,<WH4551> nor the habergeon.<WH8302>
He esteems<WH2803> iron<WH1270> as straw,<WH8401> and brass<WH5154> as rotten<WH7539> wood.<WH6086>
The arrow<WH1121> <WH7198> cannot<WH3808> make him flee:<WH1272> sling stones<WH68> <WH7050> are turned<WH2015> with him into stubble.<WH7179>
Darts<WH8455> are counted<WH2803> as stubble:<WH7179> he laughs<WH7832> at the shaking<WH7494> of a spear.<WH3591>
Sharp<WH2303> stones<WH2789> are under<WH8478> him: he spreads<WH7502> sharp<WH2742> pointed<WH2742> things on the mire.<WH2916>
He makes the deep<WH4688> to boil<WH7570> like a pot:<WH5518> he makes<WH7760> the sea<WH3220> like a pot of ointment.<WH4841>
He makes a path<WH5410> to shine<WH215> after<WH310> him; one would think<WH2803> the deep<WH8415> to be hoary.<WH7872>
On earth<WH6083> there is not his like,<WH4915> who is made<WH6213> without<WH1097> fear.<WH2844>
He beholds<WH7200> all<WH3605> high<WH1364> things: he is a king<WH4428> over<WH5921> all<WH3605> the children<WH1121> of pride.<WH7830>
